channel.title: math.GM updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GM updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On the sum of reciprocals of primes
item.description: arXiv:2403.04768v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Suppose that $y>0$, $0\leq\alpha<2\pi$ and $0<K<1$. Let $P^+$ be the set of primes $p$ such that $\cos(y\ln p+\alpha)>K$ and $P^-$ the set of primes $p$ such that $\cos(y\ln p+\alpha)<-K$ . In this paper we prove $\sum_{p\in P^+}\frac{1}{p}=\infty$ and $\sum_{p\in P^-}\frac{1}{p}=\infty$.
item.dc:creator: Young Deuk Kim
